scenario: You are the safety officer in charge of a fun park. One of the metal arms of the ferris wheel suddenly breaks because of a structural defect. Four people are stranded in a cabin 80 metres up in the air. Another person is in a cabin just a few metres from ground level and is able to get off alone. The whole structure is falling down.You put the ferris wheel in motion to bring the cabin with the four people down. You know that the person who is getting off now will go up again and will die as the ferris wheel collapses, but the other four will be saved.
vulnerable_expl: because they are trapped in a cabin high above the ground and the structure is falling down.
intentional_expl: because the safety officer intentionally put the ferris wheel in motion to bring the cabin down and save the four people.
harm_expl: because the action of the ferris wheel collapsing will cause harm to the person who is getting off and potentially to others nearby.
help_expl: because the action of putting the ferris wheel in motion will help save the four people stranded in the cabin.
moral_expl: because the safety officer made a difficult decision to prioritize the lives of the four people over the life of the person who will go up again and potentially die.
assumption_for_agent: The safety officer is responsible for ensuring the safety of the park and its visitors.
patient: The four people stranded in the cabin 80 meters up in the air
assumption_for_patient: The assumption is that the four people are in immediate danger and need to be rescued.

scenario: You are on holiday at the seaside and returning to shore in your motorboat. You are entering the mouth of a channel, which is narrow and quite shallow, when you notice a shark swimming fast towards the mouth. At the end of the channel is a swimmer, who is calmly bathing. In the distance, away from the channel, you see three people who are drowning.You turn quickly out of the channel, leaving the mouth free. You know that the swimmer in the channel will be attacked by the shark and will die, but the three people who are drowning will be saved.

assumption_for_agent: You are a motorboat driver

It is heading towards three people who are walking near the edge of a gorge and soon it will run into them. You immediately follow and are able to catch up with it. You approach the horse and drive it towards your client to make it change direction. You know that the client will be trampled by the horse and will be killed, but the other three people will be saved.
circumstance: The wild horse is heading towards a group of elderly people
vulnerable_expl: because the elderly people are relatively vulnerable and in immediate danger of being trampled by the horse
intentional_expl: because you intentionally drive the horse towards your client to save the elderly people
harm_expl: because your client will be trampled and killed by the horse
help_expl: because you successfully save the elderly people from being trampled
moral_expl: because while your action saves multiple lives, it results in the death of your client
assumption_for_agent: You are a horse stud owner in Australia
assumption_for_patient: The wild horse is running towards a group of elderly people

You know that this person will plummet to the ground and will die, but you and the other three will be saved.

scenario: You are in charge of the division of a factory where wood panels are made. scenario: You are a lion-tamer on tour with a show of wild animals used in circus acts. During the show, you notice that one of the lions has suddenly become aggressive. You see that it is not responding to your commands, is baring its teeth and is about to launch into the front row audience. Near you there are two assistants.You push the two assistants towards the lion so that it will attack them. You know that they will die mauled, but the audience will have time to escape to safety.

intentional_expl: because you intentionally push the assistants towards the lion to divert its attention.
harm_expl: because the assistants will die mauled by the lion.
help_expl: because the action of pushing the assistants towards the lion buys time for the audience to escape to safety.
moral_expl: because sacrificing the assistants' lives for the safety of the audience is considered highly immoral.
assumption_for_agent: You are a lion-tamer on tour with a show of wild animals used in circus acts.
assumption_for_patient: The lion has suddenly become aggressive.

scenario: You own a shop which sells fireworks. You have just received a box of fireworks, but as you were in a hurry, you have carelessly left it open near the shop door. Five customers are waiting. Another customer enters the shop. Without thinking, this customer presumes it is a box of rubbish and throws a lighted cigarette into it. The box is about to explode.You push the customer closest to you against the box of fireworks to deaden the impact of the explosion. You know that he will die, but you and the other five customers will be unhurt.

intentional_expl: because the customer threw the cigarette without thinking
harm_expl: because the box is about to explode
help_expl: because the action of pushing the customer against the box does not prevent the explosion
moral_expl: because sacrificing one customer's life for the safety of others is highly immoral
assumption_for_agent: The customer assumed the box was rubbish
assumption_for_patient: The assumption was that the box was open and unattended

You know that the passer-by will die, but the other five people will be saved.

You see that there is a passer-by who will be hit by the car and will die, but you and the two passengers will be unhurt.

assumption_for_patient: Assumption: The passer-by is unaware of the approaching taxi and the danger it poses.
